verses.text: How long wilt thou forget me, O \sc Lord\sc*? for ever? How long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
How long shall I take counsel in my soul, \add Having\add* sorrow in my heart daily? How long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
Consider \add and\add* hear me, O \sc Lord\sc* my God: Lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the \add sleep of\add* death;
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; \add And\add* those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
But I have trusted in thy mercy; My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
I will sing unto the \sc Lord\sc*, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
